DOC.brief_summary: Randomized controlled trial (RCT) testing the hypothesis that vitrification is superior to slow freezing.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Vitrification Versus Slow Freezing on Day 3: a Randomised Controlled Trial.
DOC.criteria: Patients (with female age < 40 years) Patients undergoing a 1st oocyte retrieval for an IVF/Intracytoplasmatic Sperm Injection (ICSI) treatment Patients planned for an embryo transfer on day 3. Patients with supernumerary embryos of sufficient quality for freezing/vitrifying on day 3. Fresh personal (own oocytes) One inclusion in the study per patient. Patients undergoing a 2nd or higher ranked oocyte retrieval after a fresh cycle with failed pregnancy. Female age â‰¥ 40 year Patients with Preimplantation Genetic Diagnosis (PGD) Patients with donor oocytes Patients with positive serology whose embryos may not be frozen. Patients planned for a transfer on day 2 or day 5. Patients receiving assisted hatching in the embryo transfer in the frozen cycles. Patients who have been included in the study before.
